114234240561511367020< /userid>
<resp>None</resp><gmapID>0x80c29706ce651e0f:0x124565b05d0069a6< /gmapID>< Name>
Corporate Offices<//Name>
<Time>1583932088004<//Time>< text>
When you walk into the building on the left hand side they do marriage licenses and birth certificates. They have 4 windows open. It gets really packed in the mornings. On the right hand side they have recordings for Real estate and for business licenses and for notary filings. They usually only have 2 windows on the right hand side so be ready to wait about 45 minutes. I have been to this recorder at least 10 times and I've never been here less than 45 minutes. Make sure your forms are printed out and ready to go before you get to the counter.</text>

<Review>This was pleasantly a nice visit. I went here to get a birth certificate and skipped having to wait in line to do the computer work and went directly to the line for picking up my certificate because you can conveniently apply for it from your phone! So while I was waiting in line I filled out the questions and by the time I got to the front I was done, made time go by fast. Then I was nervous that I'd have to come back because I didn't have master card, discover, or American Express and they still took my credit card. The lady behind the counter was so nice and quick. I am thoroughly pleased with this LA registrars office and would gladly recommend it.< /Review>< user_name>

< Text>
Have patience if you go here.  It's a stereotypical government office experience.  After you pass the shady vendors, in sunglasses, trying to sell you something to do with a DBA, you walk in to a small room.  You need to read the tiny signs up on the walls and find your line.  If you want to record documents or a DBA, go to the right (as of 4/4/19).  I witnessed two people get in the wrong line and the staff made them go to the end of the line they should have started in.  The office should post signs so people know where to stand and be respectful of peoples' time.  I fortunately stood in the right line, but still waited 40 minutes for poor service.  This location makes the DMV look glamorous.< /Text>

<text>I waited in line for 3 1/2 hours to see a Clerk for the County Recorder.  It was ghastly.   They should have people take a number and be able to sit until called, as there were many elderly who were so faint from standing so long, they just left.   When I finally made it to a window, I was told that my documents were 'unrecordable'.  No explanation, no papers were handed to me explainng why, just a rude Clerk named "Ida Beitounia" (not sure of the spelling of last name).

I pressed her for more information, as my documents were indeed in order.  She claimed her supervisor said not to record Judgment Liens.  She was extremely rude and condescending. <userid>104263633883214355968< /userid>< name>
Tiffany Thompson< /name>
<date>1573074605147< /date>< Rate>
5</Rate>
< text>
My family has been going to Stadium Dental for many years, and I've had mixed experiences, including one that caused me to leave the practice for 2 years (one dentist told me I couldn't be in the room while my 6 year old had a cavity filled; we walked out. I confirmed this was not common practice before we returned.).

Yesterday, by luck of the draw, my 9 year old had Dr. Bhangu fill their cavity. We had not worked with Dr. Bhangu before, but I immediately requested he be made my child's primary dentist. My kid has no ill feelings about dental work, but is very sensitive: ticklish, needs to know what's going on all the time, always forgets to keep their mouth open. At least 3 dentists have said they were unable to complete work on my child, mid-procedure. Dr. Bhangu was exceptional, keeping my child informed and engaged with age appropriate banter and lightning fast dental work.

My kiddo has never had such a great trip to the dentist, and was very excited when I told them Dr. Bhangu would be their dentist from now on.<//text>

< text>
Although the quality of the dental care is adequate, customer service and billing are extremely horrible and Kafkaesque. Instead of explaining additional after-the-fact charges, billing immediately activates debt collection agencies to hound confused patients.

Furthermore, the corporate culture seems to be all about pushing expensive procedures early and often.  I have never been to a dental clinic that is so pushy with (necessary?) procedures and additional add-on services.

I suggest you avoid Stadium Dental and all Pacific Dental Services (their mother company) clinics as one can find good dental care elsewhere without the aggravation and denigration.< /text>

<Text>I'm using my husband account to write this review.

If any body read review about this place I hope it help you guys.

I would give this place no star for the rating if I could.

I had my wisdoms teeths removed on 8/20/2016. With the Dr. Thomas Phan. 2 days after surgery I found that I have big hole on my gum. Look like whatever they did to close that part came out. 2 days. And I have dry socket. The bad thing is. The hole is so big. I can see my jaw bone inside the hole.

Basically my jaw bone is out and the air or any thing I eat will touch it. And it being up very bad pain. No pain killer can help when it comes to the nerves system. I can't even drink regular water without my tear drop from how much pain I have.

And the recommendation was to use ice to help with the pain. It work great if I don't have to work after a week. So I went in to see the dentist and ask for help. I have Ice pack with me when I went in. Dr. Nakata told me that I shouldn't be using the ice. He said I'm slowing down the healing process. And his attitude was bad. Like I was doing something wrong.

So I was like. Wth? One Dr. Said to use it and than another said it bad. On top of that. They fill up the hole with the paste. But it only last one day. So I have to keep going in to refill it.
Last time I went in is the 8/27/2016. And the surgeon Dr. Phan refill the paste for me. He said it should last 5 days. 2 hours later it came out. And I didn't even eat anything.

This place is horrible. I do like some people that work there but mostly it is all about money. If they don't get pay they don't want to help. Matter of fact last time I went in I got the comment that said  "hopefully we don't have to refill the paste for you again. " and that was repeat many times.

My dry socket wouldn't close up for the next year also. But they told me my skin should cover up my jaw bone in 2-3 weeks. Well, it had been over 3 weeks. I can still see the bone in there. No skin. So now I'm stuck in pain. And I hate the horrible service so bad that I'm not coming back there ever again. My husband refuse to go back there for the last few years because every time he goes in they always try to sell him something. Now my family will never go back there.

I hope they read they reviews and see this. I don't mind to say they names because people should have the right to know. At first I wasn't gonna write any review. But I keep asking if there is anything they can do to help me. All I got was no. And that I have to wait until it goes away.

I hope this useful if you thinking about going there. And I'm happy for all of you that have good experiences. I hope it remain that way

Best.

<username>Tara T</username><Date>1532130699591<//Date><rating>2< /rating><Text>See my other reviews (much more on Yelp with better choices for LA Fitness locations). I have been a member for decades (when a lot of LA Fitness locations were Ballys ' Total Fintess. The merge brought about changes (obviously) and some were good and many were not. Let me be clear, LA Fitness is cheap. They closed steam rooms in most of the facilities, they made smaller saunas in remodels except for West LA (no idea why there). They shortened open hours (this location is 11pm on weekdays (except Fri and earlier on weekends)). The Encino facility has gone downhill at least 50% since the merger with Ballys (where  I was an original member). I was grandfathered' in when they were bought out. I am beyond annoyed at the following: the old school stairmasters (not the moving stairs and not elliptical) freeze after just one session (around 30 min). I go 60 so, I have to go to another machine. Meanwhile, the other machines blow so, thanks for that. These same machines work way more efficiently (they are old school) at the Miracle Mile location. The shower curtains (used to be doors) are super cheap and see through which is just plain nasty! The lockers are an abomination (see the attached photos for a sample). I ask: how hard is it to put some dang hinges on the freakin' doors of the lockers?! There is only one electrical outlet that works in the locker room to dry your hair so, good thing I go at night  and it is nearly empty (only really good thing about a visit here). This is shameful! Additionally, the steam room was kept (probably because they do not have a sauna). The steam used to go constant but now, it barely produces any steam and cycles run around 12 minutes. This is poor mans' (womans) steam.. There are way better locations so, this is a very rare visit when I go.<//Text><pics>[{'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipO7V79sYcfNoMqKXGqpj-af8Z2jugIFh8it_XxI=w150-h150-k-no-p']}, {'url': ['https://lh5.googleusercontent.com/p/AF1QipNB1tZo5WrDlyo0sG_zYCcZ8voVjZ4IAF0jzEwV=w150-h150-k-no-p']}]<//pics><Resp>None< /Resp><Gmap_id>0x80c2984afed5aca5:0x59b9ba1c32725504<//Gmap_id></record>

<Name>Hoove Hearted<//Name><time>1508633684315</time>< Rate>
1< /Rate>
< Text>
This is the gym that LA Fitness management forgot about.  The equipment seems to be from the 90s.  All the cardio machine have rust accumulated on them.  It is very dark in there and it feels like you are in a cave.  All the equipment are placed really close together and it feels very cramped.  There is only one squat rack and only one leg press machine.

The layout is awful.  For example, the benches that are close to the dumbbell racks are about 20 feet away.  You have to walk to the other side of the room, get the dumbbells you want to work with, then walk all the way to the other side of the room to get to the bench.  It is terrible.  This place should be either fully gutted and renovated or just shutdown.  This place is pathetic and an embarrassment to LA Fitness.

Some of the picture on here are very old and it doesn't seem like this place has even tried to improve at all.  Management here is non-existent it seems.  Stay away from this place!</Text>

< Review>
Took my car in for an alignment and although they weren't able to get the numbers I was hoping for, they were able to get them close enough considering the state of my bushings and the fact my car is most likely too low to achieve the camber setting I was looking for. They also had it done a lot quicker than I was expecting. However, I will not be returning due to the fact they said it would cost about $180 and take around an hour and a half to replace the alignment bolts with the ones I had purchased. Replacing them would take me at most half an hour in my driveway with hand tools, and up on the lift while already loosening them to adjust should only add a few minutes. It's as simple as removing and replacing a bolt x8. The price for the alignment itself was reasonable but I would stay away if you need anything else done.(Edit: Turns out the most likely original 30 year old alignment bolts they said didn't need to be replaced and that would cost "$180 to swap out" were in such bad shape that they weren't able to hold my alignment. Driving to work today (the day after the alignment) something at the rear end of my car felt loose. Went out on lunch and found that one of the bolts was able to be spun with a ratchet. There goes $120 down the drain.)< /Review>

< text>
Let me tell you a story about Blackstone Tire.  Ray and Danny are the best.  I had 2 tires installed by another shop.  It wasn't until about 2 days after that I happened to be driving on the freeway, going 65-70 MPH.  I literally felt like my wheels was going to fall off or something.  It was scary.  I had to get off the freeway and drive on the streets.  I talked to a few guys and they told me it could be the brand of tires, it could be the road or it could just needs to be rebalanced.  I was going to take it to Walmart to balance it but they want me to wait about 2 hours.  TWO HOURS!! To balance 2 tires?  My dinner will be cold by then.  I called Blackstone Tire and Ray said come on it.  We'll take care of you.  I got there about 5:45 PM.  By 6:03 PM, I was done and driving home.  Whether you just need a balance like me or you need something totally different, don't go anywhere else before you see Ray.  His price is fair and just.  If ALL businesses do business like Blackstone Tire does, there wouldn't be any problems in the world.  So, if you want, you can even say TOU sent you.  He'll treat you like you are his brother from another mother.</text>

<time>1571238724296<//time></record></dataset><record>
<text>Inexpensive, well prepared seafood, including fresh oysters (I'm a fan) with a good selection of craft beers and wine.  Lots of healthy options.  Very clean and well staffed.  Deli style where where one orders and takes drinks to tables, inside or on a nice patio outside.  Then food is brought to table not long after.  Family friendly setting.  This time I had the Yellow Tail  bowl (broiled with a light sauce topping, with string beans and sticky rice) which was not highly seasoned and surprisingly very tasty.  My son and I have visited here three evenings recently. I really like the place.  It nicely fits into the slot between greasy junk food set on a counter in a paper sack, after standing in line listening for your number to be called on an intercom, and those too expensive, too long to wait, too much "pagentry" chain theme outfits that somehow always end up costing 50-75 bucks a head when all one really wants / needs is just fresh and healthy food in s sit down setting, promptly served without drama.<//text><user_id>111153559101336290760<//user_id><pictures>None<//pictures><Rate>5</Rate>< resp>

I went in to Stanton after my insurance changed to see if I could get a better deal there than at my regular optometrist. I was happy to see they took care credit. They have a large selection of different priced glasses, they do the exam in the store, and they make your glasses in store too. I went in, picked out 2 pairs of glasses, got my eye exam and was able to pick up my glasses the next day. I ended paying less all together at Stanton then I would have for one pair of glasses at my optometrist. Plus I got my glasses faster. The staff was very kind and helpful. I will recommend them to all of my family and friends.<//Review>

< review>
John Calderon and his apprentice came to my rescue today! After a string of bad experiences with plumbers who were recommended to me or referred by my home warranty, I decided to venture out and find my own. Anderson Plumbing was the first to pop up and had the highest rating in San Diego. When I called, they answered immediately (last plumber hung up on me) and had someone at my door WITHIN AN HOUR (last plumber waited seven days before coming to my condo). John was so knowledgeable and friendly. (Both of them showed my dog lots of love, so bonus points there.) He was able to diagnose the problem immediately and even showed me the exact issue (so I knew he wasn‚Äôt just trying get me to replace a bunch of parts to drive up the cost). Although the fix was pricey, he was upfront about the cost and talked me through my options. They had the parts on hand to fix the water heater and waited until the hot water was running throughout the house before they left. Although larger companies can be a bit more expensive, it was 100% worth the extra money to use a reputable, legit company who came to my aid immediately and had a mini warehouse in their truck with everything they needed to fix the problem. Paying a couple extra bucks was worth avoiding the hassle I‚Äôve been experiencing with 2-star rated companies who took a week to get here in the first place. John converted me to a loyal customer and I will only use Anderson Plumbing in the future. Also - John spoke volumes about the owners of the company and how generous they are with their employees and are wonderful people to work for ‚Äî that‚Äôs the exact type of company I want to support!!</review>

<Name>Kathie Adams</Name><date>1613842153239< /date><Rating>4</Rating>< Review>
We've used Anderson's before with good results.  This time they sent a self-professed "drain" guy to install a new kitchen faucet on a Friday.  On Saturday, we discovered a large leak under the sink.  I called customer service and the first answer was "we like to have the responsible installer do the repair, is that alright?"  Uh, no, what part of large leak don't you understand?  Turned out the earliest they could get anyone out was Monday!  All weekend appointments were "booked".  As a VIP member I expected better service than this when the leak was caused by their installer.
The gentleman who came on Monday initially intended to charge me for the visit, but backed off when I explained (again) who had caused the issue.  He was competent and knowledgeable and fixed the problem to our satisfaction, but I still contend that I shouldn't have had to spend the weekend with a leak that was caused by their employee.  And next time, if there is a next time, please don't send a DRAIN guy to do a PLUMBER'S job. I also told the dispatcher to have a Supervisor call me on Monday to discuss (no supervisor available on weekend).  That never happened.  This is not what I call VIP service.

Edited based on the prompt response I received from Erin in CS. She took responsibility,  both personally and as a company, for the issues I identified and resolved the situation to my satisfaction.< /Review>

< Text>
I wanted to do an update on my 5 star review. Change it to 1 star as I was charged 202 bucks to relight my water heater. I figured it was standard for the business but was shocked to learn was way overcharged. I was not present at the time. My girlfriend was and she definitely was taken advantage of. She was just happy to have hot water. Then I was given an estimate to replace a 2 year old water heater and they wanted 3300 bucks. You can get water heater for about 650 to 750 at home depot and get it installed for 200 bucks. This company really does wow with sticker price. Shocking. They did say they would apply the 202 towards install. Wow. Definitely do your research.</Text>

<Rate>1</Rate><review>While "Katy" was very professional in her demeanor and seems highly versed in the technical aspects of my furnace, I was surprised by the lack of specificity in the diagnoses. It could be this, this or this.  Which leads me to question, do service tech earn commission on repairs? In other words, the more parts and labor they sell, the bigger their paycheck?

Is this ethical?  Sadly, I ran into this same issue about a year or two ago with Anderson and my AC condenser. The repair estimate was $6K.  I ended up fixing it myself for $200 and it's worked perfectly ever since.

Today‚Äôs repair estimate  $1,788 + $68 for the service call. The parts, which I found online, are less than $285, and I question if they are both necessary. Labor time to replace these two suggested parts, or three suggested parts is 45 minutes for an experienced tech,  double for a novice.

With this second instance of what I believe are questionable at best business practices, and more likely unethical ones, obviously supported by management I will not use your company for any service or future sales.

UPDATE - March 2021
Apparently my review struck a nerve. Received a call and a full refund of my $68 service call fee. I still feel it‚Äôs a buyer beware situation, but I acknowledge the company did the right thing when they were called out.<//review><Pictures>None</Pictures>< resp>

<rating>1<//rating>< Text>
Despite my reluctance to deal with a huge plumbing service, I requested a plumber from Anderson to come out and evaluate why my bathroom sink drain continues to clog only 1-2 months after having it cleaned out. I was clear when booking the appointment that I did not want an 'unclog' service but for an actual plumber to come assess my issue.

Afternoon appointments are supposed to be from 12-4pm but the technician did not arrive until 5pm. When she arrived I explained what I was looking to do, just as I had explained it to the dispatcher. I proceeded to show her the issue and she removed the drawers from my bathroom sink in order to look at the plumbing.

After looking at the plumbing she indicated that she could clear the clog but it would happen again due to the drain. I explained that the purpose of the service call was to evaluate and take the steps needed to permanently resolve the issue and I was happy to replace all plumbing if needed to resolve this issue.

She continued to recommend that I have her fix the issue so the drain flows for ~$150, and have someone else come look at the drain with a camera. When I explained that I didn't want to spend $150 on a temporary fix when I was going to pay to replace the plumbing, the technician gave me attitude and left without reinstalling the drawers into my sink cabinet.

It has been difficult to get ahold of anyone at Anderson to resolve the issue. I have requested my money back and will use a different plumber to complete my project.<//Text>

< Review>
I received a call from Anderson Plumbing, Heating & Air to advise me that I was due for my annual, no cost, service on my two heaters that Anderson had installed 4 years prior.  They indicated they had a technician that could perform the service the following day.

108036070830104909731</UserId.>
< review>
Update:
Erin, Anderson's Client Relations Manager reached out via email and explained their policy of flat rate per type of the job.  She offered 15% off on the water pressure regulator job and removed the charge for accessing the valve. While I recognize the effort to provide good customer care (along with multiple text, email and phone call asking for feedback)  I cannot say I'm remotely happy about this flat rate charge that's 3-4 time higher than being reasonable.

===========================================================
Anderson Plumbing's charge is absurdly high! I had a technician come to fix a leaky waterline going into the fridge. while doing that he also found the water pressure was high and I agreed to have the water pressure regulator replaced.

He had to cut a small hole on the drywall to access the pipe, which took him 30 seconds, and the charge is $323. Note this is only for cutting the hole, not including any repair work, and they will not fix the drywall afterwards. The actual repair work of replacing the water supply line's connection valve is another $323, which I'm ok with, since at least the technician spent 30 minutes on it.

The most ridiculous one is the $1,485 charge for replacing the water pressure regulator. The part is $180 according to the technician, and it's a quick job taking him literally less than 10 minutes using only a plumbers plier. I found out afterwards a reasonable cost for this should be in the $300 range including the part, and feel quite bad not doing enough research and being an informed customer beforehand. I wish everyone else considering calling them have the chance to read the reviews beforehand and be aware of their practice of overcharging to an outrageous extent.

I do agree that it was easy for me to make the appointment, and the technician came on time and finished the job quickly in a professional manner. But I'd not be able to recommend their services to anyone due to the extremely unreasonably high cost.<//review>

<user_id>105209929384053579227</user_id><name>Benjamin Wong</name>< Date>
1588701315429<//Date>
< Rating>
5<//Rating>
< text>
We had an old water heater that started leaking.  Anderson was able to come first thing the next day to give a free estimate.  We had several companies come out and provide us quotes to replace it with a gas tankless water heater.   Anderson came in at a reasonable price but the technician, Drew (Andrew), included additional incentives that persuaded us to go with them.  Drew had everything with him and was able to get us the appropriate water heater that same day.  He relocated and installed the water heater outside of our garage by the end of the day.   We were impressed by how efficient and clean he was with his work.  We had previous copper plumbing done in our home before and Drew was impressively quicker than the other guys.  He had to come back another day to finish up other work to our house but was equally as efficient and clean with his work.  He also set us up to have our drains scoped for free.  The technician, Brent, came out to scope our drains and was equally efficient, timely, and customer friendly.  I would highly recommend Anderson, Drew, and Brent for future plumbing/heating projects.</text>

<rating>5< /rating>< Review>
I had issues with my heating, plumbing and air conditioning all on the same day. The representative that answered the phone when I called made sure I had an immediate appointment the next day and I was kept apprised of when the technician(s) would be arriving and also whether there was an earlier slot available so that I wouldn't have to wait.

All 3 of the technicians arrived on time and made me feel comfortable that they would resolve the problem.

Donald and Reggie, who handled the plumbing did a wonderful job! They explained everything to me and had me watch as they were doing the work. I have additional work to be done and they gave me options so that I could choose the most cost effective solution for my home and made an appointment to finish the work as soon as possible. Both were very competent, professional and personable and managed to resolve my issue, which gave me peace of mind.

The same was true for Mike, who handled my heating and air conditioning issues. He took the time to thoroughly diagnose and troubleshoot the problems and to make sure I was satisfied with his work before I left. I felt the pricing was reasonable given the fact that the work was warrantied by the company directly and none of them tried to pressure me into choosing a more expensive option. Reggie explained the rationale behind why it would be better to spend a little extra when it came to replacing two of the faucets in my bathroom.

All 3 left their contact info with me so I could reach them if there were any further problems and assured me that the company warranted their  work. They all also talked to me about the company's current promotions but didn't push me into going for any of them.

I had a very positive experience with Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air and I would definitely work with this company again!<//Review>

I just wanted to leave a review of the billing practices of Anderson Plumbing & Heating, that is the only portion of their work I find to be sub par.  We called them for a leaking toilet in a rental, they showed up at the appointed time and gave us the options of repairing or replacing.  We chose to replace and the work was completed on time and with what appears to be high quality.  My only complaint, the bill.  Parts and labor for an entirely new toilet was $518.98, reasonable.  The total bill was $1179, overhead & profit $660.02, which I think is too high.  They were contacted regarding the bill and they would not offer to cut any of the profit or overhead.</review>

<rating>5<//rating><text>I began my search for a plumber to fix a blockage somewhere in the line by looking for a small, family-owned business to do the job.  I previously had a bad experience with a large company and didn't want to repeat that experience. <userid>111895162016625706334</userid><username>James Christensen</username><Date>1537325674206</Date><rate>5</rate>< Review>
James B from Anderson is a fantastic plumber. I thought the drain from the toilet to the main line was blocked but he ran a few tests and determined the blockage was actually in the low-flow toilet itself. The problem was that the flush handle was not being held down long enough with the result that  the bowl was getting insufficient water so  toilet paper was not being pushed through the trap (located in the toilet) to the sewer pipe. On these low flow toilets you can't just press and release the handle- if you do the flapper valve will close prematurely. You must press and hold the handle down to keep the flapper valve open until all the water in the tank has entered the bowel.<//Review>
<pics>None< /pics>< Response>

<Review>I called Anderson to inquire about completely replacing my HVAC system in my home. When I scheduled the appointment I was assured someone would be at my home at a specific time, and that person would contact me the day of the appointment to confirm. On the day of my appointment, I never received a phone call, and even at the time of my appointment no one showed up.  20 minutes after when my appointment was going to be I had to contact Anderson to find out what happened. The operator for Anderson said "yes I see you at an appointment set for a specific time, let me see where our person is" then I was told "they will be there in 15 minutes". Well 25 minutes later and still no show, so I had to contact Anderson again. This time the operator started out giving me attitude saying "you don't understand, we don't set specific times for appointments, we give time frames".  I was then placed on hold for about 10 minutes while the operator called the person to see where they were. When the operator returned they said "Our man is at your front door right now". I about snapped because I was standing out front of my house waiting and saw nobody.  I wonder how a company that says they have great customer service can treat someone like this who isn't even their customer, and is looking to them to become their customer. If a company is this unprofessional, rude and disrespectful I would not want them doing any business with me, let alone in my house.< /Review><Rating>1<//Rating>< userid>

It was a very nice experience with Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air.  Our water heater was leaking and upon calling Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air - Julie answered the call and was extremely nice and helpful. She took the information and informed me that a Service Technician would be calling within the next 4 hours prior to coming out that afternoon. < user>
113281264389972233819<//user>
<name>Mark Sarz</name><Date>1569429365917<//Date>< rate>
1< /rate>
< Review>
When I first called Anderson Plumbing it was to fix the thermostat on my air conditioner. They told me that the unit was old (7 years old) and could not be replaced. That I would need to put in a new unit with new air conditioners. Having spent thousands of dollars with this company I figured that I had enough experience with them so that I could call them to fix a simple problem with the hot water in my shower. When they came I was told that I needed a new water softener unit for another few thousand dollars but my shower was fixed for the time being.
A couple of days later,when I had the same problem with the hot water in my shower, I made another appointment. At this appointment ,with another technician, I was told that I needed a different unit ,for another few thousand dollars, and the unit the first technician told me I needed wouldn't work. At this point I decided that I needed a second opinion from another company. In the meantime I found that the last guy they sent out had broken the hot cold water mixer on my shower. They escalated the problem to a repair supervisor who came out that week. He told me that they would have to replace the mixer on my shower, at no cost to me, and would call me in 2 days with an update as well as the exact cost of the new water softener unit he said I needed.
Two weeks later I still hadn't heard back from him. On the third week I received a message on my machine stating that the mixer had to be ordered from the manufacturer  and he would call me back the next day to discuss it. He had already tols me that it had to be replaced and I had foolishly assumed that he would do that first thing not three weeks later.
Three months later I still hadn't heard back from Anderson when I received an email message telling me it was time to make a service appointment on my air conditioners. I wrote back that I wouldn't be making any appointments with Anderson and to please remove me from their mailing list. That day I got a phone call from a very nice understanding lady who stated she was new to the job but that she was trying to straighten out problems that customer had had. She told me she would call Jose,the supervising technician who had come out the last time, and get back to me. True to her word she called me back the next day and informed me that she had ordered the part. She offered to call me every week to keep me updated which I declined.
Finally,after months, I got a call from her that the new part had come in and we made an appointment to install it.
The next time I tried to use my shower I found that only scalding hot water was coming out. No cold water to mix the hot water with. I called them to tell them what the situation was and she offered to send Jose back out to check on the problem. She informed me that since I had a tankless hot water system sometimes it took some time for the new unit to adjust. Now this explanation made no sense to me and if it makes sense to you then I'd suggest Anderson for your plumbing needs. It seems that in fixing one problem they always create a new one. To have them come out to try to fix it would be free but even at free it's far to expensive for me.
I wouldn't recommend Anderson to anyone  They're always   trying to sell you something new and can't seem to be able to do what they are hired to do correctly.
Stay far far away from this company.

Mark Schwartz< /Review>

None< /Pictures>

< Review>
I am a VIP customer (cancelled) who had three problems in my bathroom.  A very knowledgeable technician arrived on time to bid on repairing problem.  Prices quoted were absurd, like an automobile repair,
Each item was individually priced: e.g.  $200 to put flapper on toilet and reinsert flush handle (I had the parts); $200 to look under sink to repair leak ( loose plastic nut on drain lever) and no quote to repair leaking faucet as he didn't have the part on truck even tho when I made the appointment I specifically stated the the make of the faucet handle.

< text>
After a number of calls to various plumbing companies I got in contact with Anderson plumbing.  I had a leaking pipe and all companies were booked for the new week out or longer.  Anderson however took the time to check for any cancellations on a Friday and said they could have someone out later that afternoon.  My technician was Ken and he was super friendly and helpful with all the questions I had.  Our leak was in the attic and we have a tankless water system.  The area where our leak was had been over complicated with a number of bends and unused feed off points.  Ken replaced the copper piping and simplified the water flow for less stress on the piping.  He took the time to turn on all the faucets after repairs to flush all the air in the lines and showed me the new piping that he replaced to make sure he answered any questions I might have.  Anderson plumbing and Ken were very professional.  From talking to the booking agent on the phone to having all my questions answer to finding someone to come out so I didnt have to worry for an entire weekend.  Great company and I highly recommend them!!!!< /text>

< user_name>
Steve Bates</user_name>
<date>1535235701368</date><Rating>5</Rating>< review>
After a number of calls to various plumbing companies I got in contact with Anderson plumbing.  I had a leaking pipe and all companies were booked for the new week out or longer.  Anderson however took the time to check for any cancellations on a Friday and said they could have someone out later that afternoon.  My technician was Ken and he was super friendly and helpful with all the questions I had.  Our leak was in the attic and we have a tankless water system.  The area where our leak was had been over complicated with a number of bends and unused feed off points.  Ken replaced the copper piping and simplified the water flow for less stress on the piping.  He took the time to turn on all the faucets after repairs to flush all the air in the lines and showed me the new piping that he replaced to make sure he answered any questions I might have.  Anderson plumbing and Ken were very professional.  From talking to the booking agent on the phone to having all my questions answer to finding someone to come out so I didnt have to worry for an entire weekend.  Great company and I highly recommend them!!!!< /review>

They gave me 3 different options  to solve my problem.  Not a "you need this" attitude.  A picked my option and thought they would come back in a day or two to do the job.  That did not happen!! I will definitely be calling Anderson Pluming  in the future.  (that is if the need arises)   Thank's so much for your quality service.      David< /Text>

< Text>
After a number of calls to various plumbing companies I got in contact with Anderson plumbing.  I had a leaking pipe and all companies were booked for the new week out or longer.  Anderson however took the time to check for any cancellations on a Friday and said they could have someone out later that afternoon.  My technician was Ken and he was super friendly and helpful with all the questions I had.  Our leak was in the attic and we have a tankless water system.  The area where our leak was had been over complicated with a number of bends and unused feed off points.  Ken replaced the copper piping and simplified the water flow for less stress on the piping.  He took the time to turn on all the faucets after repairs to flush all the air in the lines and showed me the new piping that he replaced to make sure he answered any questions I might have.  Anderson plumbing and Ken were very professional.  From talking to the booking agent on the phone to having all my questions answer to finding someone to come out so I didnt have to worry for an entire weekend.  Great company and I highly recommend them!!!!< /Text>

<review>Smelled gas coming from beneath our stove, which is very alarming. Shut off the valve underneath, aired out the kitchen, but hours later still smelled a bit of gas. Called something like 5 different plumbers asking for help as I have three young kids in the house and a wife who is due to have our fourth ANY MINUTE! Very much a serious situation. Despite this, every plumber I called either didn't respond or they were too busy to help. Then, I realized a family member recently used Anderson and she gave me the name and number of the actual technician that helped her out so I gave them a call and asked for James by name.  They appreciated how urgent this situation was, and James came out right away. He and his teammate arrived and were pleasant to work with from the start. They were always professional, and obviously experts at what they do. Throughout the entire process they communicated with us frequently so we always knew what was going on, what progress they've made, what their recommendations are, and what options we had. They were also very clear and direct with the costs associated with each option, and we never felt pressured into paying some exorbitant amount for optional services. They worked hard the entire time, being very sensitive to my family's particular situation. After the gas leak was fixed, James came back a few more times in the following days to do further tests to make absolutely certain things were done right and that everything was still holding up after they made the repairs. He even came out personally to meet with underground leak detection services (a third party), spoke to city gas company on our behalf to get our gas turned back on, and worked directly with the city inspectors office to get all the appropriate inspections and paperwork in order. Now, my family has gas service again! More importantly, this means we have a working clothes dryer, furnace, and HOT WATER. I could not have asked for a better experience in an otherwise really difficult situation.</review>< rating>

Anderson Plumbing has completely unreasonable prices. Honestly, I really can't understand how they can have so many 5 star reviews unless people really don't care how much they pay for plumbing service.  Here are the facts of my case: I had a plumbing leak which they located for $262 when two other plumbers where quoting $130 for leak location.  I went with Anderson since they were the first to be able to come to my house.  After they found it they quoted $900 to repair a simple copper elbow. Another company quoted me a third the cost over the phone. Then came and fixed it in less than 30 mins. <rate>5<//rate>< Text>
I called Anderson Plumbing to repair a bathroom sink drain that was leaking.  I also had several small plumbing related jobs that I really did not want to do myself so I decided to have them perform this work in addition to the repair.  I had never contacted a plumbing service before and decided on Anderson Plumbing because they have been in business for so long and had a great rating with the BBB.  I can honestly say that it was a pleasure working with this company.  The phone representatives are polite and courteous.  The technician showed up on time, treated my home with care, and conducted himself in a professional manner.  The visit started with a walk through and discussion about the work to be performed, some Q&A, full disclosure of the charges (the forms they use are very detailed), and lastly a time estimate to complete the work.  The plumber, Reggie, did a wonderful job.  When he finished we performed another walk-through to review the repairs.  He answered all of my questions and provided some helpful tips.  I would definitely use this company again.</Text>

< text>
Ron, the plumber was great! . I told him the property was in the middle of selling and we needed this I spection for the buyers today. We had requested a non intrusive camera scope to verify if there was a leak or moisture inside the wall. When he walked in empty handed I asked if he had the camera with him, he replied no, then I went off and reacted terribly.  Even though I was a l irrate, he remained calm.  I told him the owner specifically requested it when she ordered them to come out.  He immediately called his office to see what the issue was and found out that for some reason, whomever took the appointment did not put that in the call notes.
He calmly recommended some options of cutting into the wall and what that cost would be, or would have to wait until the plumber with the scope could be scheduled. We decided to remove a piece of drywall ourselves so he could look in and he thoroughly inspected the area visually and what he couldn't see he stuck his arm in the wall to feel around for any water or dampness. He was gracious the entire time and explained everything so clearly and calmed me down.  He also wrote up the findings on his tablet and emailed it directly to us while he was still on site. What a fantastic man and employee you have!  Sincerely, Denise Lisa, the owners realtor. I will definitely recommend your company to all of my clients. However please make sure your schedulers understand what the client is asking for, what type of plumber they need and write everything the customer requested, verbatim, in the remarks!</text>

<UserId.>102028627427651721886< /UserId.><name>Giovanna Thomas< /name><Time>1542905571324< /Time><rate>4<//rate><text>I used Anderson for their plumbing services and I was satisfied with that work.  Despite being over priced, I liked both of the technicians who came to my house.  However, I am EXTREMELY dissatisfied with HVAC services that I received.  The technician came to my house and instead of assessing all possible options (which I later learned there were other, cheaper options), he went straight to the $1300 blower motor option, which knowing nothing about HVAC, I figured that was what was needed.  The technician installed the blower motor and it worked for less than 24 hours.  Anderson came back and this time brought back a salesman who tried to pressure me into spending 9-10 THOUSAND dollars on a completely new system.  I felt very uncomfortable about the sales tactics and I could tell that my technician was also uncomfortable.  Eventually the salesperson left and the technician agreed to try a simple remedy, adding refrigerant to the system.  They were originally going to try to charge me $200 for this, but decided to spare me the expense.  The system worked for only a few hours.  I eventually changed the outlet and that got the system working for a couple of weeks.

It broke again, and after talking to other professionals in the area and my family friend back at home about it, they explained that I was completely ripped off and completely overcharged for something that failed to work.  They also explained that the prices that they were quoting me for a new system were completely absurd.  I feel completely taken advantage of; the company realized that my spouse and I were not savvy in the HVAC realm and they pounced on the opportunity to make as much money from us as possible.

I ultimately hired a new professional to fix my broken system and they explained that the motor that was installed by Anderson had already broke and also that there were other fixes to try prior to replacing the blower motor originally.  I tried to get some or all of my money back from Anderson, but they were very difficult to reach, have given me the runaround, and refuse to do anything because I did not give them the opportunity to fix the problem.  I explained that I know that they took advantage of me and that I was uncomfortable with their sales tactics and they just choose to slander the professional that I used to fix the problem and try to affix the blame on me in any way possible.

If you cannot tell, I am completely dissatisfied with the assistance that I received from Anderson and I will never use them ever again and will be sure to tell anyone who will listen to never use them again.  They just want your money and will pretend to be helpful and charming in an attempt to get you to trust them and spend all kinds of money on things that you do not need.

< Text>
Just now wrapping up the installation of a completely new HVAC system. These guys were one of three  companies to quote us and by far the least professional,  knowledgeable, and affordable. When Paul  came and to take a look at our systen back in April for a quote,  he immediately said he had never seen one as old as ours and didn't know what to do.  Old? Yes.  Not knowing what to do even when you are the expert? Not a good thing.  His recommendation was to ask my neighbors (who just got theirs replaced) what they did and then call him back. Needless to say,  I was livid. Once pressed, he emailed me with an estimate on something he "thought" would work for over $12,000. So, beyond the horrible service and lack of professionalism, they were also really overpriced. I went with a different, extremely well rated family owned company who was literally HALF the cost; same quality system and similar warranty; and knew immediately what to do when they saw our outdated system. I can't speak to their other services, however I would strongly recommend NOT using this company for HVAC needs.</Text>

<Review>Contacted Anderson Plumbing for a slab leak. Brian was the tech that came out, and he gave us a recommendation and the cost. Did a copper re-rout that led to the kitchen. A week later another copper pipe leak showed up in a different area. Requested that Brian come back out to investigate. Found a pin hole leak in the copper pipe which he spot repaired to stop the leak. Based on the two leaks we discussed a full copper re-pipe of the house. We decided to go this route as we have been spared of water damage up to this point. We requested that Brian do the work. Brian does excellent work. He plans things out, does not rush, keeps the house clean by using plastic around the work area, and makes sure we have use of some running water while replacing the old piping. At this time (because all the plumbing was being disconnected) we replaced a toilet  and some tub and shower valves. This was a big job and we appreciate Brian's dedication. <review>Larry was very courteous, answered my questions and tried to trouble shoot the problem.    He was on time, respected my property.  What he did not do was remove the trap.  I did not ask him to but when he ran water and could not reproduce the back up of water in the sink, he might have thought of that.  I thought of it later the night and asked the next person who looked at the sink when it backed up again to do that.  We found a child's toothbrush which had obviously been in there for some time.  I am not faulting him but the next time I would definitely make sure the trap be removed from a sink that is backing up.

I also had Zak B. out for the same problem.  Again he ran water, tried to reproduce the blockage.  We went over everything that had been done the day before, we checked the clean out on the side of the building and then I asked him to remove the trap on the sink.  He did and we found a child's toothbrush in the trap.  Again if I had not asked to have it removed the problem would have recurred.  I am happy I asked but I think the technician should know to remove a trap if they can't reproduce the blockage with running water.  Something has to be causing the sink to backup several times.<//review>< resp>

< review>
I called Anderson to have a broken disposer replaced. Calling the job in already a great experience - ''How can I make you smile today?'' just works! Scheduling was without problems and I got called 30 minutes before the technician arrived. Justin M. impressed me right away, because he listened to my problem description, then assessed the work involved, presented me with the options available. I chose, he did the rest - a sizable job as it turned out. In-between and after having finished, he warned me that, perhaps, another unrelated problem might arise in the near future. He counseled me on the work to be done, if that were the case. Justin explained everything very well. He also asked me if there were other problems and, on me mentioning one, he took care of it. The parts that he needed were on the Anderson truck - they are fully stocked as the advertisement says. Justin left the job site clean and tidy. The part that he had mentioned might be on the brink of failure actually did fail a few hours later. I called it in, the time was set and Justin took care of the rusted out part the next day, same time. No fuzz, no huff and puff, Anderson and Justin just did it. I had used this company before, and was happy, but it has gotten even better!</review>

< review>
I Have a 5 year old central AC system that kicks out cold air fine, but have had problems with occasional water dripping from above. CJ ( technician) arrived at the 1PM requested time and immediately began his diagnosis of the problem. Within 10 minutes he figured out the problem (which was two-fold) and began the fix. After a time on the roof to check out and adjust the system, be began the repair inside.
His cleaning of the main drain hose from the air exchanger and the hose below to the drain was completed successfully. All is now Good!

As a side note, I've been in business successfully for a number of years.  I was very impressed with my technician (CJ).  He is a remarkable individual on two levels.  He has extraordinary people skills combined with very strong technical ability.  That's an excellent combination that's difficult to find in employees today!</review>

< user_name>
heather sullivan<//user_name>
< Review>
Tried Anderson Plumbing, Heating, and Air for the first time. Having only one full bath, it was a bit of an emergency when the shower wouldn't drain, and dripping faucets were rapidly filling the shower stall. Technician James, attempted to clear the blockage, but only got 2 feet into the drain. After informing him of old cast iron pipes in the crawl space beneath our house, he called a camera specialist, Ricardo, to determine the problem. We needed a new trap and 10 foot length of modern-day "code" pipe. James was able to temporarily stop the dripping faucets. Unfortunately, we weren't able to schedule the fix-up for a week later.

One week later: Larry, a very knowledgeable man with plenty of on-the-job experience, and a supervisor as well, arrived about 8:30 AM (on time), fully explained all of the work that was to be done, and answered all of our questions. Then he went right to work. The beneath the house work was accomplished pretty quickly, but the new, Moen, single handle faucet kit was a bit of a challenge. Larry had to remove an area of tile, and saw through 2-inch concrete and lathe in our "vintage" shower stall. When the job was completed (by mid-afternoon), the shower drained well (with its modern, 4 inch pipe), and we had a shiny Moen faucet/plate and shower head. They were so well-installed that one couldn't tell that they were replacements. No damage to the existing tile and well-sealed.

On the same-day that James and Ricardo came out, (at different times), I was only charged $42. Ricardo prepared the cost, with options. In my opinion, the fee for the option that I chose, was fair, considering the time, labor, and parts involved. On repair day, no attempt to oversell, no surprises. My white tiled bathroom was left clean, and undamaged. Larry even wore shoe covers to protect my dark hardwood floors and oriental rugs where he had to pass through the house.

I definitely will call Anderson again for its caring, knowledgeable, experienced, professional service for plumbing repairs on my OLD house. Thank you, James, Ricardo, and Larry.<//Review>

Sorry for the duplicate, but I think I posted this on a site that feeds into Google.
WARNING! Outrageous prices. Confusing and complicated fee schedule with ‚Äúup front pricing‚Äù (Stupid me, for not reading the reviews before calling them.) I discovered a slight leak from one of the toilet tank bolts. I checked online to see what needed to be done (remove tank & bolts, sandpaper the hole, replace). The cost of the bolt & gasket kit online, $8.55. Instead of DIY I called Anderson. I told the plumber there was a leak from the bolt‚Ä¶I guess he took a look at me and thought, ‚Äúfemale, old, dumb‚Äù, or else the plumbers are pushed to upsell. He said, ‚Äúoh no, it‚Äôs leaking from, etc‚Ä¶.‚Äù I told him to put his finger on the left bolt and feel the water. I didn‚Äôt need or want anything else because I had just a few weeks previously changed out the ‚Äúinnards‚Äù of the tank. So he quoted me‚Ä¶$657.00! A rip-off. We hassled over the price (I really should have just asked him to leave). After ‚Äúcalling his manager‚Äù, the price was reduced because I didn‚Äôt need a ‚Äúfull tank rebuild‚Äù, which I never asked for. I still was overcharged. Less than an hour work, plus a $8.55 part. He tried to impress me that I was getting a 2-year warranty (on a $8.55 part).
Their fees are based on 9 levels, with a price for each individual item in each level. As an example, for the work I myself did previously: In level 2: toilet flapper, plus a tank trip lever. My cost $38.00 online, plus 5 minutes of work. Their level 2 pricing: Flapper $269; Trip lever $269 = $458. As I said‚Ä¶beware.< /Text>

My name is Erin, I am our Client Care Manager here at Anderson PHA. I was able to pull up your account and research the details. First I would like to apologize that we were not able to get out to you sooner, we were very busy due to the Holiday, and we sincerely apologize that you had to call another company out. We are very glad I was an easy clearing for you. Our intentions are to be able to get to every client that needs us, unfortunately that isn\'t the case always.\nI also was able to get information on the estimate given for the camera and report requested. Our normal camera charge is $250.00, and an additional fee to place findings on a flash drive for your records. However, when a client needs a "Plumbers Report" there is more to just the camera-ing of the line. Because the city will not take the report from a homeowner, only a licensed plumber- our technicians have to camera the line, place the findings on a disc, write up an official findings report, take these to the city and file the report along with their form- this is why the price increased. I was also informed that the city will not do anything regarding roots in the line, corrosion or build up. There has to actually be a break, or collapse in the line for them to come out and repair/replace. If the line is able to be hydro-jetted to clear out roots or buildup- they will expect the homeowner to take care of this at their expense. I hope this gives a little more insight to your concern. I know it doesn\'t help that we were not available sooner to come out, please call me directly if you have another issue and I will work directly with a technician for you.\n\nSincerely,\nErin Hanson\nClient Care Manager\n619-449-3852\nAnderson PHA\nerinh@andersonpha.com'}< /resp>< GmapID>

Called Anderson because one of my neighbors recommended them and couldn‚Äôt have been more disappointed. Bernard showed up and was very nice but tried to gauge me on price. I hit my water line in my yard while I was digging and needed a small piece of copper pipe coupled. I already had the pipe dig out so all he needed to do was cut the pipe and install the coupler. He even admitted that the job would take 30-45 minutes but once he input everything into his iPad he wanted to charge me $650!  I know a Saturday call may cost a little more but it was only 3pm and for less than an hour of work and maybe $50 in parts this seems like trying to gauge someone who you know doesn‚Äôt have water right now. I told him no and he preceded to charge me $99 just to come to my home.  So if you don‚Äôt agree to their way inflated price you still get charged.

I just called a local plumber in the neighborhood and he finished the work in 30 mins and only charged $300. He was gonna charge less but I insisted on giving him that much after my experience with Anderson. Make sure you shop around before using these guys. <Text>I did not have a good experience with this company. I had them out to move a gas line and repair a leak coming from one of the fixtures in the upstairs bathtub. I usually try and stay home when people are working on the house for supervision and to answer questions, but this time I couldn't. Upon arriving home after work I found a 1 ft by 2 ft hole in the bathroom ceiling that was in the room adjacent to where the gas line was being moved and I received a message saying that I could not use my bathroom shower as the pipe below had been cracked. I do realize things happen on a jobsite, but this was a bit ridiculous. And to top it off, when I reached out to the plumber for clarification, he stated it was my fault and that I would have to pay to get everything fixed. He said he would "work with me" on the price but that he is "covered and took pictures." Being in the medical field, I liken this to a surgeon repairing a ACL, but in the meantime cutting the MCL. Apparently the gas line had fallen when he cut it which caused the hole in the spare bathroom ceiling and when he was unscrewing the drain plug, he broke the pipe below. After much argument, the plumber did agree to fix the pipe that was broke but I had to supply all of the parts and the hole in the ceiling I would have to fix. Overall, if you want your house to be in worse shape after you pay $1500, call this company.

After my review for this company I noticed that they had responded with a "we do not have you in our records, please call this number." I proceeded to call this number and express my concerns with their work. After leaving a message and waiting 2 weeks, I have now determined this must be an automated message by the company and this "we do not have your records on file" is a way to make them look like they care. Bad all around!!!</Text><gmap_id>0x80d95825767feffd:0x9128f1cbf9c2d015</gmap_id><Rating>1<//Rating>< date>

<date>1461794267049< /date>< UserId.>
105195650982475930255< /UserId.>
<gmapID>0x80d95825767feffd:0x9128f1cbf9c2d015< /gmapID>< pictures>

<Text>This was my second experience with Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air.  I was having issues with my upstairs bathroom sinks not draining.  I tried to fix it myself, but to no avail.  I decided to call Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air because my previous experience with them was an excellent one.  I called a little later in the evening and was pleasantly surprised  that someone was there to take my call.  I was greeted with a warm, "Thank you for calling Anderson Plumbing, Heating and Air, how can I make you smile today?!"  What a nice way to greet your customers!  Right away, you know that you are going to be taken care of.  I was easily able to schedule an appointment.  The first appointment offered was on a Sunday.  That is so great that they could send someone over the weekend.  I knew I wasn't going to be home on Sunday so I made the appointment for the early 8-12pm window on Monday.  Usually when a company gives you a window of time, you can usually count on them coming at the end of the time, if not much later.  This is really inconvenient when you have to take half a day off of work just to wait for a technician.  Not the case with Anderson.  I got a call at 8am saying that the tech would arrive by 9am.  And he arrived by 9am!  Larry introduced himself, shook my hand, and asked for permission to enter my house.  Before he entered, he put on his booties without being asked.  After I explained my plumbing issue to him, he clearly explained what actions he needed to do and explained in detail what the cost was going to be.  I asked Larry if he would mind if I watched so I can learn how to fix a clog in the future.  He said, "Sure" and proceeded to educate me and explain step by step what he was doing and why and how the plumbing worked.  He was happy to do it and appeared genuinely proud of the work he was doing.  Many techs want to be left alone and don't want to be bothered.  Turned out that my drain issue was a bit complex.  Larry used his industrial auger, which put my 20 ft hand auger to shame.  When that did not work, be broke out the beast auger and that fixed the issue.  Despite having to go back and forth to the van to get supplies, despite having to go up and down and stairs, inside and outside the house, Larry stayed calm and collected, didn't mind removing and putting back on his booties.  When he finished his work upstairs, he cleaned up the entirety of his work area and then some.  He sprayed down the counters and glass with cleaner and he made sure he left the bathroom area nicer than when he arrived.  He even thanked me for my help, even though I was there observing to learn from him.  Larry recapped everything that he did, explained the warranty of his work, and made some recommendations without being one bit pushy or salesy.  I was so impressed by Larry's work ethic, professionalism, integrity, and passion for his craft.  Coincidentally, that day was "National Hug a Plumber Day".  To show my appreciation, I offered Larry a tip so that he can buy lunch or whatever.  He graciously said, "No thank you, it was my pleasure to serve you, use that to take your kids out to lunch."  What a great guy!

The next day, based on Larry's recommendation, William came over with his nifty video device.  In order to make sure that there were no other issues with my pipes, William fished his video camera down into my pipes.  We were able to clearly see inside the pipes, maybe 20 feet or so.  This was displayed on the video monitor.  When he was done, William said everything looked good, there was no additional blockage.  He recommended hydrojetting (washing) of the pipes, but at this point it was not an emergency, but should be done at some point in order to avoid future clogs.  I appreciated his honesty when he could have easily tried to upsell me.

This is a testament to what a great company Anderson is.  Built upon family values, they really take the time and effort to show that they care and appreciate their customers.  If you have any plumbing, heating or air issues, I recommend Anderson without reservation!< /Text></record></dataset><record>

<Text>I needed some minor plumbing/fixture work done on my home to get it ready for a home inspection.  My typical plumber did not have availability within the time frame.  I remembered the AWSOME trucks I had seen around, and being a professional female myself, I thought I'd give them a try. Calling and scheduling the appointment was great--super professional without a long wait for service. The service charge was extremely reasonable as well. The guy arrived on time and was really nice.
Before entering the house, I showed him a water spicket that had a stripped handle on it. He said he would look at it before he left but it would be expensive (odd  I thought). One of the jobs was to have a "sticky" diverter (from bath to shower) loosened because it was gritty and difficult to manipulate.   No parts, not major work.  Problem:  the quote to have that done was $550!  Really.  $550.    I declined and showed him another bath tub  where the water stopper was not attached to the Kohler lever so the water would not drain.  He did not know how to fix the Kohler but suggested a toe tap drain.   This, I had to do because I needed it for an inspection. The charge: $330.  Really.  It took him 5 minutes.
He overheard me on the phone telling my real estate agent that the charge was too expensive and he apologized  stating that he didn't set the prices, he only enforced them.

After he left, I got a squirt bottle with vinegar and soaked and manipulated the gritty diverter.  Works just fine.  Really, Really disappointed.< /Text>< GmapID>

George Richards</Name>
<Date>1457905270398< /Date><rate>5<//rate><Review>Russel and John got tasked to correct a difficult Return Air ducting issue with a new install of a Lennox 4 ton HVAC unit in an older existing structure. The original Return ducting consisted of a single 12" round duct. The unit needed at least 1500 cfm, when it only had 600 cfm. I thought we could get another through the lower story into the mechanical room, but only a 6" was able to be installed due to framing and other mechanical systems interference. The solution,  since I did not want the exterior of the structure opened up, was to have the service tech, Russel, crawl up through a small opening in the ceiling of the outside mechanical room; upwards through a 2 story chase, in order to remove the existing 12" and cut in another 12' round to double that capacity. Both Russel and John never hesitated when evaluating the job. They jumped right in, finished in a remarkably short time, made the connections in extremely tight areas, worked cleanly and neatly. The A/C unit now produces the full 4 ton capacity with no problem. Kudos to these guys for their work and extremely positive attitudes, and know how; to be able to get a difficult remodel situation solved.

<date>1433820650295<//date><text>I contacted SDG& E about a gas smell in my foyer.  They came out and found no gas readings in the home yet checked out the system and found it was changing pressure enough to warrant a complete gas turnoff and lock.  That was on June 2nd.  That same evening I contacted Anderson Plumbing on the web and was contacted that same evening to schedule a technician to come out.

Chris B was very professional.  He and his associate went through the system thoroughly and methodically assessing the situation.  Unfortunately, with this older structure finding the problem was difficult.  But through a process of elimination, Chris was able to narrow it down to an single location and had a theory on the possible issue.  He then proceeded to let me know of the delay in completion do to the fact that he wanted to be sure and not demo my home any more by using a helium test to pinpoint the problem.

The next day the problem area was found and the repairs were down quickly.  Unable to get the County to move faster they were not able to come out on Friday to sign off on this.  The whole weekend was a "no Hot Water"  weekend.

On Monday we got the County Inspector(if you can call him that.)  He immediately treated you staff as if they we amature Craigslist Handymen.  Telling them they did the repair all wrong and used the wrong hardware and proceeded in accusing Chris of not being "qualified"  to do the work because he didn't have a certification card.  He even said this work wasn't finished,  made them change a flex line in the furnace to a hard line( not why he was here by the way) and walked out as Chris tried to explain to him where was mistaken and that he is a professional at his work.  Chris was then, after at least 15 minutes convinced the inspector that he was right.  The inspector basic conditionally approved the turn-on.  And wanted Chris to return to shut off everything later this week so he can come back out and inspect the fixes himself and the pressure reading as well.  Preposterous Crap!

Well Chris got the job done and he and his associate(sorry I for got his name) was supurb, and after six days my wife can now washer her hair.  That's all that matters.

Thanks Chris
Thanks Anderson.
